website_summaries.verdict: A top choice for serious outdoor use and climbing – the most versatile and well-built crampons on our list.
pros: Easy to put on and adjust, thanks to the secure metal mechanism that locks in place
Lightweight yet rugged – works well on almost any terrain
Has 14 long spikes built for climbs
cons: A bit pricier than hiking crampons
Some competitors are more practical for users who don't intend to climb in them

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy to fit to boot
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to fit to boot. Sorry to say, I have not tried to wear them on the job. I will be using them to assist maintaining traction on steep terrain while cutting trees. Seems like they should be good for that use.
customer_reviews.author: Skip A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Hiking
customer_reviews.text: Needed something a bit more aggressive than Micro spikes to have sure footing. Lazy Mountain (terribly deceiving name) in Ak is doable in microspikes but felt so much safer in crampons. Hiked on packed snow, ice and shale stone. The shale stone ground down the sharp edges a bit but none of the spike bent and still grabbed the snow and ice as needed. I wouldn’t go ice climbing with them but for secure footing on a steep winter hike, they were great!
customer_reviews.author: TJG

customer_reviews.title: Good enough to summit Shasta
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from summiting Mt Shasta in NorCal. These crampons had me a little skeptical at first but after our two day summit and descent I would vouch for them. Seems to be made of a light aluminum painted over? The rubber held up as well as the linkage, no issues there. I used these crampons with my khyber military leather boots and fit just fine. If you are just getting the feel for mountaineering I would definitely look into trying these prior to spending $$$ on another pair. Trust me these things are great!
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good Grip
customer_reviews.text: I have a hill on my property so steep that it's nearly impossible to scale. Slap these bad boys on and i'm walking up and down no problem. The only issue I have with these is that my foot slips out sideways if i'm walking perpendicular across the hillside
customer_reviews.author: matt walker

customer_reviews.title: Solid on Shasta
customer_reviews.text: Chalk up another Mt. Shasta summit using these crampons. I used these on La Sportiva Trango Cube Mountaineering Boots with absolutely no issues, felt solid and confident the whole way up and down, very happy with these at this price point. I think Shasta might be the upper limit with these, though, I'm not sure I'd trust them in tougher conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Busch97

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and solid grip
customer_reviews.text: Very bright color which can't be missed! Very sturdy and solid grip. Once they're on your boots, they can be a bit difficult to remove, but they really stay on when you need them! They seem to be holding up very well and that's considering all the salt used here during the winter. People everywhere comment on how great they look and how much they wish they had something like it! They look bulky but they don't feel that way nor are they heavy to wear. Make sure you tuck in your pant legs well or they can rip the fabric or make small holes in it!
customer_reviews.author: l. leslie

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for Mount Hood
customer_reviews.text: Worked well enough to make it to the top of Mount Hood going up Pearly Gates!
customer_reviews.author: Royal

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a May hike to the top of Mt St Helens and I have to say they worked just great with no issues. They have a similar design to many other brands that cost 2-3 times as much. Every step up snow and ice felt secure and I was able to submit the mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Rochette

customer_reviews.title: Amazing crampons
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my hiking trip up to Exit Glacier. They were absolutely amazing and worked perfectly. I would definitely recommend them to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy Boles

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Used these to climb South Sister (Bend, OR) in May. They worked great! Stayed on my Columbia boots real snug and kept me from slipping going up and down. There was snow the whole way. And they look nice!
customer_reviews.author: Jared Emard

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: First time out with the brand new crampons. Properly fitted and tightened in place. Clearly light weight aluminum. Both broke less than two miles in.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and great in ice and frozen pack
customer_reviews.text: Decent set being light, easy to setup and great traction as long as the snow is frozen or hard pack. In mashed potato snow it balls up and can be very dangerous if you're on the side of a mountain and have to knock snow off them to keep good faction and not fall. Would work well for ski boots.
customer_reviews.author: Sampkpr

customer_reviews.title: Don't hike without these in winter
customer_reviews.text: Love these crampons. Wore them this weekend for a hike in the white mountains of NH. I had worn just spikes on another trip and slid all over the place, these kept my footing beautifully. Took a moment to figure out how to tie them to my boot, but once I got it I was fine. I'm a size 10 woman's boot and there was still room for a bigger boot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great traction for deep snow
customer_reviews.text: Use them for hiking in deep snow. Don't move around at all on the boots like the chains do. They do put some stress on the ankles when the snow gets thin.
customer_reviews.author: Woods

customer_reviews.title: Helens
customer_reviews.text: Worked surprisingly well and held up to the occasional hidden rocks under the snow. Climbing Helens would have been very hard without these.
customer_reviews.author: Juggles

customer_reviews.title: Spikes ground down to bent nubs on mixed terrain.
customer_reviews.text: After just 2 uses, I have to replace these with a sturdier crampon from a real mountaineering company. These wimpy aluminum crampons will work in pure snow, but when the terrain goes from ice and snow, to rock, and back to snow, it's not reasonable to have to take your crampons off and on each time. So I kept my crampons on while stepping on the rocks. I've done this on microspikes without having a problem. However these crampons ground down almost completely. If you are going to climb a mountain, you need trustworthy equipment. These are NOT trustworthy crampons, and products like this could get someone killed. Two thumbs way down.
customer_reviews.author: Josh J.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I climbed Mount Shasta with these July 2019. If I get another summit out of them, then they will have paid for themselves by replacing more expensive rentals. They are definitely not as well made as the more expensive brands but they worked fine, so that tells me paying more just gets you over-built equipment. In really extreme conditions I would not trust this brand, without extensive testing, but on a 14'er like Shasta they did fine. They will be my "light duty" crampons until they break.
customer_reviews.author: J. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the prize
customer_reviews.text: Got my up and down snowy Mnt Whitney. Great product for the prize.
customer_reviews.author: andre

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for glacier hiking!
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect for hiking glaciers in Alaska. We do not usually hike on ice, but these provided the perfect amount of grip to allow us to hike up glaciers for extended periods of time. We hiked Matunuska and Root glacier and had a wonderful time using these. They are perfect for ice hiking and are very durable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these back in June, and on my first use while baggin Mt. Shasta the straps broke and I ultimately wound up compromised with broken crampons after just buying a pair of $65 crampons. I bought these after feeling confident in the reviews I had read that the crampons would be sufficient for my needs, but unless I happened to get a broken pair I wouldn’t recommend investing in these.
customer_reviews.author: Bcole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent crampons
customer_reviews.text: I actually gave them to my daughter who lives in Alaska and loves hiking all year round. She really loves them and can no longer do without. Excellent crampons, light, reliable and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: junk
customer_reviews.text: If you're going out to get the mail...maybe...anything else...nope...cast metal of some sort is ultra brittle. I broke these inside of an hr, bought the petzel's and was able to cross a mountain glacier without too much trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Jim L.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction. Very light weight for as tough as they are. Easy to put on any kind of footwear. I'm very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, I walked with it even on a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good quality,I walked with it even on a lot rocks and dirt cause I don't have time to take it off after the snow in the mountains,it works greaty,with this price and this quality nothing to complain.
customer_reviews.author: Xukai Tang

customer_reviews.title: Please make a version with an anti-balling plate.
customer_reviews.text: It's now highly recommended that crampons include an anti-balling plate by the UIAA. I love how light weight they are, but if I had to choose just one, I would only buy the S1-A that includes an anti-balling plate, even though they're steel and heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Bryant Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Held up well on rock and snow
customer_reviews.author: William Bensley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Use these for walking solid ice switchbacks. Very light and work perfectly. Even comes with a nice case
customer_reviews.author: Who's your dady

customer_reviews.title: Looks OK, not as big as described in comments
customer_reviews.text: I ordered to fit a size 13 hiking boot and they do not fit. Size 12 does fit inside cleat.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Used these to trek up Mt Whitney in massive amounts of snow. Crampons stayed intact in my boots the whole time. Sooooo helpful with snow/ ice trekking m!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin cox

customer_reviews.title: Great Traction
customer_reviews.text: Worked really well hiking up a steep snow gully on a 12000’ peak. They strapped right onto our hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Lehr

customer_reviews.title: they are slightly heavier than other crampons but for the price I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: I have used these crampons once. They stayed tight, and gripped very well on ice. they are slightly heavier than other crampons but for the price I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Durability issue
customer_reviews.text: One of the teeth snapped off the first time using these.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Great crampons for walking on ice but not for as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great crampons for walking on ice but not for as much steep terrain, i highly recommend them for icy trails.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Abate

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed! They didn't fit my La Crosse Iceman boots ...
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! They didn't fit my La Crosse Iceman boots or my Irish Setter Snow Claw boots. The backs are to narrow and the front is also too narrow ( the fold down parts ). Will have to get a RMA # to return these un-worn. That's as far as my review can go.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

product_meta.title: OUTAD Traction Cleats/Crampon for Snow and Ice
product_meta.description:
Description:
OUTAD stainless steel crampons is easy to use with almost all size.
Technical Details: 
Color: Blue Material: Manganese steel Weight: 2.4 oz
TIPS:
1.It is necessary to adjust the crampons to suit the size of shoes (boots) so that all the edges of the soles contact with the crampons. Improper size can cause inconvenience in use and may cause safety hazards.
2.After installing the crampons, press down so that the soles are in full contact with the crampons and then bundle them.
3.When climbing up, pay attention to and check the status of the crampons at any time: if the rivets, screws, straps are loose, and if the buckles are displaced.
4.When grinding the crampons, use a guillotine to finely grind them manually, and do not use the grinder to grind them. The high temperature generated by the grinding wheels will affect the crampons steel.eopard" crampons video tutorial, master the correct method before you can safely use this product
5.Do not heat the crampons or bake them near the fire. High temperatures can affect the crampons' steel and damage the cramp's strength and durability.
6.Please clean the crampons and then put them into the storage bag and store them in a clean and dry place.
7.The steel structure at the bottom of the crampons is sharp and can easily cause scratches and sticks. Please use it with caution.
Package Includes:
2 x crampons
1 x net bag
feature_bullets: size can be easily adjusted by double row of rivet studs.

【New Design for Outdoors】The Crampon is an ergonomically designed design that better fits and protects your feet for a safer, more comfortable outdoor sports experience.suitable for both male and female of any age of teenagers, adult, elders.Design stronger grip and can prevent move side-to-side, keep you safe for Boots Grips Walking, Jogging, Climbing and Hiking on Snow, Ice, Mud, Sand and Wet Grass

【Ergonomic structure】14 teeth of different sizes can grasp the ground well. Rubber widen and more resilient, Welding chain stronger, with more robust spikes. surprisingly secure and stable, bite aggressively and stay in place on all inclines. spikes are positioned and a wide margin, while bend foot there is still traction in the front, but also comfortable and give a real feeling of security, always have very sure footing, the best bet for avoiding injury.

Lighter and tougher, it helps to deliver unrivaled traction on icy winter trails. The main body of elastomer band is comprised of stretchy Thermoplastic Elastomer (TPE) which is of flexibility, anti-abrasion as well as anti-tearing and could improve longevity for a quick and secure fit on a variety of footwear.

Ice Snow Grips Adopt TPE band:Thicken TPE band ,Tolerant to -45°C /-49℉,which is of flexibility, anti-abrasion as well as anti-tearing and could improve longevity for a quick and secure fit on a variety of footwear.Traction Cleats has 18 Stainless Steel Teeth:18 heavy duty stainless steel teeth and strengthening chains,with long-lasting soles that bite into the slickest ice and snow.The spikes are made from heat-treated stainless steel for excellent durability and corrosion resistance.

【Low Price Promotion 】60 Days 100% Satisfaction Guarantee: If you are not 100% satisfied with this product for any reason, please contact customer service within 60 days, and we will immediately refund your purchase
